alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 4:24PM CST until December 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CST/830 PM EST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Bradley, Hamilton, Marion and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CST /830 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM CST /524 PM EST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Dunlap, Jasper, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite, Whitwell, Kimball, Monteagle, Ridgeside, Fairmount, Harrison, Red Bank, Collegedale, Powells Crossroads, Orme and North Chickamauga Creek Gorge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
